question.title: Unable to get thread dump? Any ideas why my app blocks?

node.contents: I also have this problem and it seems (no guarantee) that it happens mostly on 64 bit jvms.

astNode.text: I also have this problem and it seems (no guarantee) that it happens mostly on 64 bit jvms.

node.contents: do the requests all go to the same server ? (i.e. are you sure it's not the server which does not respond to the request ?)

astNode.text: do the requests all go to the same server ? (i.e. are you sure it's not the server which does not respond to the request ?)

node.contents: I have a basic java server app that has 100 worker threads that do simple HEAD requests on urls. I'm using HttpClient 4.x for this.

astNode.text: I have a basic java server app that has 100 worker threads that do simple HEAD requests on urls. I'm using HttpClient 4.x for this.

node.contents: A few minutes into the run my program just freezes for a couple minutes and I cannot figure out why. Check out the screen shot of what visual vm monitor reports. You can see it flatline. During this time I'm unable to get a good thread dump and visual vm just freezes until it's unblocked. Does anyone have any ideas on what I can do to try and start debugging this guy?

astNode.text: A few minutes into the run my program just freezes for a couple minutes and I cannot figure out why. Check out the screen shot of what visual vm monitor reports. You can see it flatline. During this time I'm unable to get a good thread dump and visual vm just freezes until it's unblocked. Does anyone have any ideas on what I can do to try and start debugging this guy?

node.contents: I've seen several bug reports about jstack on Linux with a similar trace:

astNode.text: I've seen several bug reports about jstack on Linux with a similar trace:

node.contents:
• JVM Bug Id: 6494722 (is supposed to be fixed)
  • Ubuntu Bug #597098 (this one is not)

astNode.text:
• JVM Bug Id: 6494722 (is supposed to be fixed)
  • Ubuntu Bug #597098 (this one is not)

node.contents: Do you get the same result with a kill -3 <pid>?

astNode.text: Do you get the same result with a kill -3 <pid>?

node.contents: What worked for me was running jstack as the process owner without -F.

astNode.text: What worked for me was running jstack as the process owner without -F.
